concepts.name: Graphs of Quadratic Functions
concepts.description: Exploring parabolas, their characteristics, and how they are influenced by coefficients in quadratic equations.

concepts.name: Vertex and Axis of Symmetry
concepts.description: Identifying the vertex as the highest or lowest point of a parabola and its symmetrical nature about a vertical line.

concepts.name: Graphing Quadratic Functions in Intercept Form
concepts.description: Using the intercept form of quadratic functions to find roots and graph parabolas more efficiently.

concepts.name: Solving Quadratic Equations by Graphing
concepts.description: Using graphs to identify solutions (roots) of quadratic equations and their relation to the x-intercepts.

concepts.name: Quadratic Equations by Square Roots
concepts.description: Isolating the squared term and taking square roots to solve quadratic equations, including handling perfect squares.

concepts.name: Completing the Square
concepts.description: A method for rewriting quadratic expressions into a perfect square trinomial form to solve or graph quadratic equations.

concepts.name: Vertex Form of Quadratic Functions
concepts.description: Rewriting quadratic functions in vertex form to directly identify the vertex and simplify graphing.

concepts.name: Solving Quadratic Equations Using the Quadratic Formula
concepts.description: Applying the quadratic formula to find the roots of quadratic equations, including understanding the discriminant.

concepts.name: The Discriminant
concepts.description: Using the discriminant to determine the nature and number of solutions for a quadratic equation (real, double, or complex).

concepts.name: Linear, Exponential, and Quadratic Models
concepts.description: Distinguishing between linear, exponential, and quadratic relationships using differences and ratios in data.

concepts.name: Mathematical Modeling
concepts.description: Applying functions to describe, analyze, and predict real-world phenomena through models based on quadratic equations.

concepts.name: Optimization with Quadratic Functions
concepts.description: Solving real-world problems involving maxima or minima using quadratic models, often related to parabolic shapes.

concepts.name: Projectile Motion
concepts.description: Modeling the motion of objects under gravity using quadratic equations and analyzing key points like maximum height and time.

concepts.name: Exponential Regression and Curve Fitting
concepts.description: Using graphing calculators to find equations of best fit for data, comparing linear, quadratic, and exponential models.

concepts.name: Real-World Applications of Quadratics
concepts.description: Solving problems involving geometry, optimization, and physical phenomena using quadratic equations and functions.
